profile.name: Dr. Jane Smith
profile.title: Assistant Professor of Computer Science
profile.bio: I am an assistant professor in the Computer Science Department at MIT. My research focuses on the intersection of machine learning and computer vision, with applications in autonomous systems and medical imaging. I completed my Ph.D. at Stanford University in 2023.

research.description: My research develops novel deep learning methods for understanding visual data, with particular emphasis on medical imaging and autonomous driving applications. I am interested in creating more robust and interpretable AI systems that can generalize across different domains.

news.content: Received NSF CAREER Award for research on interpretable AI
Gave invited talk at Stanford Vision & Learning Lab
New graduate student positions available for Fall 2025
Paper on medical image segmentation published in Nature Medicine

publications.title: Robust Medical Image Segmentation via Self-Supervised Learning

publications.title: Transfer Learning for Autonomous Driving in Adverse Weather

publications.title: Interpretable Deep Networks for Medical Diagnosis
Few-Shot Learning for Domain Adaptation

education.thesis: Deep Learning Methods for Cross-Domain Visual Understanding

education.degree: B.S. in Computer Science (Summa Cum Laude)
